content: On Tuesday, McCain, along with Sen. Russ Feingold (D-WI) and Rep. Paul Ryan (R-WI), announced that he would reintroduce legislation to provide the president with a line-item veto to target wasteful spending. This came just one week after the president's press secretary, Robert Gibbs, told reporters that Obama would "love to take [a line-item veto] for a test drive." "http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2009/03/03/obama-mccain-relationship_n_171453.html" I do not agree with a line item veto. If we do that we might as well get rid of congress and the senate all together and have a dictatorship. Umm that's not a bad idea actually, 1 king to worry about instead of hundreds..

title: McCain Works With Obama on Line Item Veto
